column4: does anyone know how to diagnose a broken vlc, it wont start, i dunno how to test what it might be
try opening it from the command line with vlc -vvvv
if it gives too much info, drop a few v's
i dont know what im looking for
when it crashes there might be an error reported in the output?

Halitech ,right did that an it all seems fine apart from the last line which is LibVLC fatal error locking mutex in thread 3082135248 at misc/objects.c:395: 22 Error message: Invalid argument at: /usr/lib/libvlccore.so.0(vlc_pthread_fatal+0xb5)[0xb8060235]
that's the problem, I'd go ask in #videolan, tell them you're seeing that and it's crashing
resets any config changes you've made
might help, might be really annoying, might do nothing....
